definition[0]: the right to enter a place, use something, see someone etc
example[0]: Access to the papers is restricted to senior management.
example[1]: Cats should always have access to fresh, clean water.
definition[1]: how easy or difficult it is for people to enter a public building, to reach a place, or talk to someone
example[2]: We’re trying to improve access for disabled visitors.
example[3]: a villa with easy access to the sea
definition[2]: the way you use to enter a building or reach a place
example[4]: Access is by means of a small door on the right.
example[5]: Access to the restrooms is through the foyer.
definition[3]: the legal right to see and spend time with your children, a prisoner, an official etc
example[6]: My ex-husband has access to the children once a week.
definition[4]: to find information, especially on a computer
example[7]: Users can access their voice mail remotely.
definition[5]: a former type of credit card in the UK which is now known as Mastercard
definition[6]: the right to sell goods to a particular market or country without breaking any laws or agreements
example[8]: Japan agreed to allow foreign manufacturers of satellite equipment equal access to the Japanese market.
definition[7]: the way in which you are able to find information held on a computer
example[9]: In order to simplify access to the data, the computer program enables users to specify their own requirements.
definition[8]: when you are allowed to see official documents
example[10]: The National Union of Teachers has proposed that parents should have access to their children’s files.
definition[9]: the ability to buy a product or make use of a service
example[11]: The move is intended to widen the access to credit.
example[12]: Many poorer residents have no access to health care.
definition[10]: the right to remove money from where it is invested in order to use it
example[13]: Policyholders often feel more confident if they have access to their funds.
example[14]: The software enables each client to access data from other databases.
definition[11]: to be able to use something
example[15]: Many customers now access their accounts using the internet.
